concept.title: Uninstalling the Native Client
concept.shortdesc: How you uninstall the native client depends on your operating system.

section.title: Uninstall on Linux and Solaris
section.p: On Linux and Solaris, delete the NativeClient_Linux_architecture_xxxx_bNNNN product directory or the NativeClient_Solaris_architecture_xxxx_bNNNN product directory and all of its subdirectories.

conbody.section:
Uninstall on Windows
Use the MSI installer graphical interface, its command-line interface, or the Windows Control Panel.
Uninstall from MSI Installer Graphical Interface
Double-click the MSI file, then click Next in the Setup Wizard screen.
In the following screen, click the Remove button.
In the next screen, click the Remove button and then click Finish.
Uninstall from MSI Installer Command-Line
This is the MSI command-line syntax for a quiet uninstall: msiexec /q /x Pivotal_GemFire_NativeClient_architecture_xxxx_bNNNN.msi DEFAULT_INSTALLDIR=<path> lists common msiexec command-line options for use with Pivotal_GemFire_NativeClient_architecture_xxxx_bNNNN.msi, along with an explanation of their usage. For a list of all command-line options, enter msiexec/?.
The /x option uninstalls the product.
Uninstall from the Control Panel
From the Control Panel, open Add or Remove Programs.
Select Pivotal GemFire Native Client [32bit or 64bit] [x.x.x.x] (with the values appropriate for your installation.)
Click the Remove button.
